Agra civic body sends notice to 16 ad ag.description: AGRA: Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) administration once again sent notices to advertisement agencies for installing unipole hoardings in violation of norms instead of removing them. This time, notices have been issued to 16 advertisement agencies. They have been asked to remove unipole hoardings placed at unapproved spots. Besides, the notice mention that agencies will have to pay double charges for using both sides of the unipole for advertisement. Some agencies have been hoodwinking the AMC by getting permission for a single unipole and using both sides to put up advertisements. Earlier, councilors had raised the matter with the civic body administration. According to senior AMC councilor Ravi Mathur, “The installation of unipoles following the develop-operate- and-transfer (DOT) model is largely taking place in violation of standard norms. Private advertisement agencies are causing revenue loss to the AMC. But civic body officials continue to remain lenient towards them. Only notices are being issued as a formality.” AMC chief engineer AK Singh said, “Notices have been issued to advertisement agencies for violation of norms in placing unipole hoardings. In case, the wrongly placed hoardings are not removed within 15 days, then strict action will be taken against the agencies. It has surfaced that some of the agencies are using both sides of the unipole by depositing charges for one-side advertisement. Such agencies will be identified and double charges will be recovered from them.” The AMC administration had in a bid to curb installation of illegal hoardings in the city had allowed agencies to set up unipoles at 600 points across 100 wards of the city. The unipoles were planned to be positioned on road sides. But in violation of norms, the agencies placed them on road dividers. According to provisions of AMC adverstiment policy, there must be at least 250 to 300 meters distance between two unipoles. But around 60% unipoles in the city have not been set up as per the standard distance between them. In this regard, complaints had been received by the district administration and the state government. Earlier in February, AMC had issued notice to 24 agencies to remove unipole hoardings installed in violation of norms within 15 days. But no advertisement agency took the trouble to do so. Instead, councilors complained that 12 new unauthorized unipoles were installed by private agencies listed with the civic body. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aligarh Muslim University students raise.description: AGRA: Students of the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) have raised objections over yoga day celebrations in the campus as the arrangements made by the administration are made common for men and women. According to students, these celebrations are nothing but a waste of money as nobody would become healthy by doing yoga for a day. “These celebrations are meaningless and if the authorities want to make some difference, they should organise yoga classes round the year,” former president of students’ union, Faizul Hassan said. AMU court member, Shafikurhman Khan from Theology department also opposed the yoga day celebration in the university. He said, “We welcome yoga if it is part of the curriculum but not if it is forced under a particular ideology.” He added that it’s unfortunate that yoga, instead of being seen as a science, has been given a communal colour. Former vice-president of students’ union, Hamza Sufyan said the amount which is being spent on the yoga day celebrations should be spent on education as the varsity’s budget has been going down every year. Talking to TOI, spokesperson of the university, Shafey Kidwai, said, “these are all baseless allegations. Week-long celebrations are planned for the International Yoga Day.” According to AMU administration, the varsity has been observing the International Yoga Day since 2015, but this year, the celebrations have been marked by a series of events. Some prominent yoga exponents have been invited to deliver lectures and hold workshops. The week-long programme is being organised by AMU’s Department of Physical Education. BJP leader murdered by brother over prop.description: AGRA: Aligarh’s BJP youth wing vice-president, Saurabh Sharma, was allegedly beaten to death at his house on Sunday night by his elder brother over a property dispute. According to police, the incident occurred around 10 pm when Saurabh’s elder brother Abhishek Sharma came back home in Jaiganj locality, where the joint family resides. Both brothers had an argument over some property matter and things soon turned ugly. Abhishek allegedly picked up a pedestal fan that was lying nearby and hit it on Saurabh’s head and then fled from the place. Family members immediately rushed Saurabh to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries. Saurabh was also the member of district working committee and brother-in-law of former BSP MLA Mukul Upadhyaya. Senior superintendent of police (SSP) Akash Kulhary said that a case has been registered against five persons including Abhishek and his relatives under sections 302 (murder), 34 (when a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all), 147 (rioting) and 148 (armed with deadly weapons) of IPC on the basis of a complaint filed by the deceased’s wife Lily Sharma. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

3,300 out of school children identified.description: AGRA: Following orders of the state government, the basic education department had identified over 3,300 children who were out of schools. In first three months of the new session which started in April, all the identified students have been enrolled in the state government-run primary schools. They will be attending regular classes from July after end of the summer vacation. However, the data compiled by the basic education department indicate that the state government’s special program named ‘Sharda – School Har Din Ayein’ for enrollment of out of school children ended in a formality in rural areas. According to the official data, in city areas and 15 blocks of Agra district teachers identified 3,332 children between age group of 6 to 14 who were not going to school. Out of these 1,063 were enrolled in city areas, whereas in entire Fatehpur Sikri block only seven children were found not going to school. Ahead of the new session, state government had directed that teachers should step out of schools to identify children not going to school. Teachers were required to spread awareness about benefits of education especially among weaker sections of the society, and ensure no child is left to get benefit of free education. In city areas, teachers took out rallies to promote the Sharda program. Non-government organisations also made efforts for enrollment of the out of school children. Apart from city area, 413 out of school children were enrolled in Jagner block, 370 in Kheragarh, 264 in Baroli Ahir, 210 in Pinahat, 201 in Khandoli, 161 in Bichpuri, 12 in Fatehabad, 114 in Jaitpur Kalan, 94 in Shamshabad, 85 in Fatehabad, 50 in Bah, 46 in Achhnera, 43 in Saiyan, 39 in Akola and seven in Fatehpur Sikri. District in-charge of the Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan said, “The admission process will continue till September end. After reopening of schools in July, second round of campaign to identify out of school children will be launched. This time the focus will be on rural areas. Teachers will reach every doorstep to take children to school. Officials will also make efforts to ensure every child goes to school.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Clerical mistakes, sloppy verification c.description: AGRA: Clerical mistakes and sloppy verification have cost long delay for around 42,000 farmers in Agra district who are yet to receive their first installment of Rs 2,000 under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-Kisan) scheme. The scheme was announced during the 2019 interim Union Budget on February 1. Taking cognizance of the complaints made by farmers, the state government has now directed the district administration to correct the clerical mistakes. A re-verification process will begin soon as part of clearing the first installment. Under the scheme, financial benefits of Rs 6,000 per year was declared for all small and marginal farmers having total cultivable holding of up to two hectares. The amount will be provided in three equal installments of Rs 2,000 each in a period of four months in the financial year. The benefit will be admissible for transfer with effect from December 1, 2018. To the benefit of the PM-Kisan scheme, farmers were required to make an online application. In Agra district, over 3 lakh applications were received on the PM-Kisan portal. The district administration after verification of the applications had forwarded details of 2,33,002 farmers eligible to be benefitted under the scheme to the central government. Out of these, 1,91,012farmers have received two installments of Rs 2,000 each while 41,990 farmers have not received the amount in their bank accounts. Farmers who have not received the monetary benefit are making rounds of the sub-division offices and agriculture department. District agriculture officer Rampravesh Verma said, “Due to some clerical mistakes and discrepancies in details submitted by the applicants, around 21% of the farmers have not received benefits under the PM-Kisan scheme. Revenue clerks have been asked to conduct re-verification of such farmers and correct mistakes in their eligibility report. We will ensure each and every eligible farmer gets the benefit of the scheme”. Major reasons restricting transfer of benefit under the PM-Kisan scheme include wrong Aadhaar card or bank account number and faults related to land record of farmers. In some cases, bank accounts of farmers have been non-functional for a long time. During the verification process, 65,000 applications were rejected while a large number of fake applications had surfaced. Fictitious applications under the names of Narendra Modi and Yogi Adityanath were also detected. Multiple online applications with same name and address were also identified and cancelled. \u2018Probe usage of fuel by garbage veh.description: AGRA: Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) is spending over Rs 1.25 crore per month on fuel for operating garbage collection vehicles. If maintenance of vehicles and salaries of employees are added, then around Rs 3 crore is spent every month for lifting municipal solid waste (MSW) from 100 wards of the city. Notwithstanding the expenses incurred, city roads continue to be littered with garbage. Garbage is not lifted regularly in several localities and sometimes not even taken to the Kuberpur landfill site. It is dumped in different parts of the city and set afire. As per an estimate, more than 200 metric tonnes of MSW is burnt on every day. Now, municipal councilors are planning to raise the issue with mayor Naveen Jain and demand an investigation of the entire matter. According to AMC sources, around 750 metric tonnes of MSW is generated in the city on a daily basis. For collecting and ferrying the garbage from different parts of the city to Kuberpur landfill site, AMC has a fleet of 284 vehicles for the purpose. However not all are roadworthy. Municipal commissioner Arun Prakash, “On an average, 1.95 lakh litres of diesel is consumed every month by garbage collection vehicles. But out of 284 garbage collection vehicles, 31 are more than a decade old. Around eight of the old vehicles are not in working condition.” This means that 276 vehicles are functional. Therefore, the cost of running these vehicles is a surprise. Councilor of ward number 64 (Belanganj) Anurag Chaturvedi said, “Though I have not calculated in details but 276 vehicles consuming 1.95 lakh litres of diesel every month means that approximately each is operating for eight hours every day. This is highly suspicious.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shortage of doctors hits emergency and O.description: AGRA: Acute shortage of doctors and specialists has hit the OPD and emergency services at the government district hospital in Aligarh. While 30 EMOs are required for a hospital with around 300 beds as per NITI Aayog guidelines, Malkhan Singh district hospital, which has 232 beds, is being managed by only one EMO and a few specialists. Patients and their attendants continue to have a tough time as only one Emergency Medical Officer (EMO) is working. There are no cardiologists, physicians, dermatologists and dental surgeons in the hospital. Chief medical superintendent (CMS) of Malkhan Singh district hospital, R Krishan told TOI that they are working on a theory of maximum work in minimum facilities. He admitted that patients are facing problems. With the specialist doctors put on emergency duties, they have to wait for 2-3 hours in OPD. The CMS said that at present, the hospital has two paediatricians on record but only one is working along with three general surgeons, one ophthalmic surgeon and one ENT surgeon. “We have written to the higher authorities to fill the vacancies and are hoping to get more doctors soon,” said Krishan. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Teenager rescued within hours of kidnap.description: AGRA: A 14-year-old boy, who was kidnapped by three armed men near St Marry’s church in Agra on Tuesday, was rescued within three hours by the Khandoli police. The victim has been identified as Ashish alias Arpit Upadhya, a class IX student of Convent School. According to the police, Ashish was sitting in his car while his father had gone to a nearby store in St Marry’s church area when three men kidnapped the boy at gunpoint around 6.50 pm. The kidnappers demanded Rs 2 crore ransom. Ashish’s father Dharmendra Upadhyay(50), who works in the LIC, said he immediately called up the police. Circle officer Sadar Vikas Jayaswal said, “After receiving the call, we immediately formed a team to find Ashish. We conducted through checks and installed barricades at the outskirts of the city.” Jayaswal said they were able to locate Ashish after he managed to escape from the clutches of the kidnappers and made a call to his father disclosing his whereabouts. He said a police team immediately reached Mudi police post and rescued the kid. Talking with TOI, senior superintendent of police, Jogendra Kumar said the kidnappers are on the run and assured to nab them soon. “The boy has identified the accused. We have formed a team to catch them. They will be behind the bars soon,” Kumar said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Agra doctor held for hiring shooters to.description: AGRA: Monitoring movement of a recently released contract-killer from jail helped Agra police to prevent the murder of a gym trainer and landed a city-based orthopedician in jail. The 33-year-old orthopedician, who practises at his father's private clinic in Bagh Farzana area of Civil Lines, was arrested late on Friday evening for plotting murder of gym trainer Tarun Gupta who he suspected was having an affair with his wife, who's a gynaecologist. TOI is withholding the accused doctor's name to protect the identity of his wife. Three other men, including Deepak Singh, the doctor's driver, Rajat Singh, a private pathology employee, and contract killer Satveer, who hails from Firozabad district, were also arrested. Anuj Kumar, station house officer of Sikandra, told TOI, "After monitoring the movement of shooter Satveer and his aide Vikas, we found that two were planning to eliminate a gym trainer. We picked up Satveer and interrogated him. During investigation, he spilled the beans." According to police, Satveer claimed in his confession that the doctor's driver Deepak had contacted Rajat Singh for a contract killing. The three, including the doctor, met Satveer and Vikas at a cafe in Sanjay Place and offered Rs 5 lakh to eliminate gym trainer Tarun Gupta. Later, the orthopedician also took the two contract killers in his car to identify the gym trainer and show them his residence. "During questioning, the doctor claimed that he suspected his wife was having an affair with the gym trainer. He also claimed that he had sought help of his parents-in-law to end the affair but it didn't help. That's when he decided to hire a killer to get him eliminated," the SHO said. Police said CCTV footages also confirmed the doctor's meetings with the contract killer. Police recovered a .32 calibre country-made pistol with three cartridges from the contract killer. All the four accused have been booked under IPC's sections 107 (abetment of a thing) and 115 (abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life-if offence is not committed). Aligarh Muslim University gets new proct.description: AGRA: The Aligarh Muslim University authorities have appointed professor Afifullah Khan of the department of wildlife sciences as the proctor on Monday. An order to this effect was issued by university registrar Mr Abdul Hamid (IPS). As proctor, Afifullah would be responsible for maintaining law and order in the university and act as a liaison between the university and district administration. Professor Afifullah is a distinguished academician who has a vast administrative experience as well. He will take over charge in addition to his own duties for a period of two years or until further orders. He has been a part of the university since 1989 when he joined as a lecturer in the department of wildlife sciences. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two weeks after minor girl murder in Ali.description: AGRA: Almost two weeks after the body of a 2.5 year-old brutally murdered girl was found in Aligarh’s Tappal area, another mutilated body of a middle aged woman was discovered in a deserted plot in Simrautti village near Yamuna Expressway on Sunday. According to Tappal police, the woman’s body was wrapped in a black polythene and it was spotted by some local residents. Police said, prima facie, the body had been dumped at the spot after killing the woman. Local Forensic Science Lab (FSL) team was called for taking samples as liquid was found near the woman’s body. Police said the deceased woman was about 40-year-old and was wearing a Saree and a blouse. She appeared married as she had “kangans” on her wrists. Talking to TOI, Tappal circle officer Sanjeev Dixit, said that body will be sent for post mortem and further investigations are on to identify the deceased and her killers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Stray dogs menace hits Taj Mahal.description: AGRA: Even as the Archeological Survey of India (ASI) continues to grapple with the simian menace at the Taj Mahal, the world heritage site is now under ‘attack’ of stray dogs, compounding problems for both the tourists and the staff. A video of stray dogs roaming inside the Taj lawns went viral on social media on Tuesday, attracting criticism from the netizens. This comes at a time when on an average 150 cases of dog bites are reported every day in Agra, according to data shared by the health department. However, ASI superintending Archeologist in Agra circle, Vasant Swarankar, claimed that the dogs that were spotted on the Taj premises were removed immediately. He said the stray dogs enter the premises only during rain, when the staff and other people are indoors. Tourism Guild Association secretary, Rajiv Saxena, however, termed it “utter negligence’ on the part of the officials. “I am deeply hurt, as the symbol and icon of the Indian tourism is being allowed to be thronged by dogs.” A hotelier in Taj Ganj, Sandip Arora, said such kind of pictures and videos raise questions over security at Taj Mahal. “It is also the matter of tourists’ safety, who spend huge amount of money to see the world heritage monument,” he said. He added that the tourists were earlier bitten by simians inside the monument, and now stray dogs are creating a scare for the travellers. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

ACs fail to cool waiting lounge at ISBT,.description: AGRA: Passengers at the Inter State Bus Terminal (ISBT) here have to sweat it out every day as the air conditioning of the waiting lounge has not been functioning properly for quite some time now. With temperatures hovering over 40 degrees Celcius for the past fortnight, they face a tough situation. The AC lounge has been specially made for passengers who travel by air conditioned buses run by Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC). Over 70% of the buses run by UP roadways in Agra are air conditioned. Under the circumstances, passengers who pay a hefty sum for an AC bus ticket feel cheated due to poor facilities and maintenance of ACs in the lounge. The air conditioned waiting lounge at the ISBT has two split ACs. However, it seems, they have not been serviced for long despite hot summers in the city. The cooling is so poor that passengers are forced to fan themselves. Surprisingly, on record, both air conditioners are shown working 24x7 along with electricity consumed. The AC lounge has no fan. On an average, around 50,000 passengers take a bus from ISBT every day.. Vivek Bansal, a passengers waiting to board a bus to Lucknow, said, “UPSRTC is cheating passengers. I had booked two AC tickets for Lucknow. Since the last 30 minutes, we are suffering due to the heat. My wife is feeling suffocated. Officials must take cognizance of the situation.” Pawan Kumar, who was going to Delhi, said, “The AC waiting room at ISBT is useless. I was not able to sit there for 10 minutes and had to get out. The fans at the waiting area for general passengers were also not working properly. I was not able to find a water cooler to quench my thirst. UPSRTC must value the convenience of the passengers.” When contacted, ISBT station head Hans Raj insisted that the ACs are working properly. He said, “Both the ACs at the waiting room are functional. Due to high temperature and frequent movement of passengers, ACs may not be able to provide proper cooling. We will get the situation checked. Necessary action will be taken to ensure that passengers are not inconvenienced .” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aligarh Muslim University vice-chancello.description: AGRA: A day after the Aligarh Muslim University’s (AMU) Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College (JNMC) administration declared the junior doctors’ strike as “illegal”, varsity’s vice-chancellor, Tariq Mansoor, has appealed to the 500 protesting doctors to return to work. The doctors went on a mass earned leave on Monday to protest against the non-implementation of the seventh pay commission. Principal of the JNMC, SC Sharma, said, “As resident doctors had gone on leave without any notice or application for a leave in their concerned department, their leave or strike would be considered illegal and strict action will be taken against them.” Spokesperson of the university, Shafey Kidwai, said that the AMU administration has been in constant touch with the University Grants Commission (UGC) and Ministry of Human Resource and Development (MHRD) officials for the immediate implementation of the revised pay scales and allowances of junior and senior resident doctors of the JNMC, pursuant to the seventh pay commission recommendations. He said that if the protesting students do not join their duty immediately, the administration will be forced to take action according to its rules and regulations. Informing about the latest communication in this regard, Kidwai, while citing Prof Mansoor’s letter, said that Rajnish Jain, secretary, UGC, has further written to Ishita Roy (IAS), joint secretary (higher education), Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, to “expedite the MHRD concurrence for implementation of the revision of pay and allowances of junior/senior resident doctors of medical colleges/hospitals of AMU, BHU and University College of Medical Sciences in pursuant to the 7th CPC”. He said that the VC has urged the resident doctors to join back so that the medical facilities are restored to the ailing patients at the earliest. President of the Resident Doctors’ Association (RDA), Dr Abdullah Azmi, said, “We had called off protest earlier after 109 days of dharna following assurances by the administration but after seeing no positive response from them, we have been forced to go on indefinite mass leave.” He added that medical services are affected but emergency services are working as 80 senior resident doctors, 350 consultants and around 600 paramedical staff are on duty. He further said that they have been struggling to get their demand implemented for the past one-and-a-half-years and no one had paid heed so far. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. With no drinking water, UP family seeks.description: AGRA: Upping the ante against unavailability of drinking water in a Hathras village, a family has written a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking permission to end their lives, as the government had failed to provide them basic facilities for their survival. The missive has been filed by Chandrapal Singh, an MBA graduate, who had earlier decided to auction himself along with several youths in the village on Republic Day to raise money for supply of household water connections. The protest, however, did not take place as, it was cancelled by local administration. Besides the letter, Chandrapal, a resident of Nagla Maya in Hasayan block, has released a video in which he and his minor daughters appealed the PM Modi to listen to their complaint, else give them permission to end their lives as they can not drink excessive “salty” water. Singh said that it is unfortunate that even after 72 years of independence, they have to travel several kilometres for getting drinking water. In a video clip, Singh said, “It is better to die once than to live everyday in pain. We have been suffering from this problem for the past two years and no one has resolved this issue”. He added that he has to walk at least 2-3km everyday to bring drinking water for the house in the weather when temperature is touching 45 degree Celsius. “No one can understand our plight. Government officials cannot even take a sip of water, which we drink to survive. Our children too consume the same water,” he said. Claiming that over 3 lakh people in 150 villages in Hathras are affected by the problem, he said that they have written about about their plight to everybody, from the the district magistrate to the President of India, but the issue has not been resolved yet. When contacted senior divisional magistrate Sikandrarao, Ramji Misra, said that issue will be resolved soon. He said, “Many projects could not be taken up due to model code of conduct in the recent elections”. He assured to take up this matter on priority. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. RTO sends notices to take 50,000 old veh.description: AGRA: Over 50,000 vehicles which are more than 15-year-old and are plying on Agra roads have been served notice by the city’s regional transport office. In the notice, the owners have been asked to take the vehicles off the road. “They have been given time till August end, or the vehicles will be confiscated,” an RTO official said. According to Anil Kumar Singh, RTO enforcement, “All the vehicles registered before 2004 should be removed from Agra roads as they create immense air pollution. The apex court has already given clear instructions to not to allow old vehicles in Agra, as it comes under protected Taj Trapezium Zone (TTZ).” TTZ is an area of about 10,400sq km spread over the districts of Agra, Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and Bharatpur in Rajasthan. Ironically, the RTO has allowed these old vehicles to ply in TTZ if they get their registration from other districts. Dr Sharad Gupta, physician and a well-known environmentalist said, “There is a big flaw in the law of Motor Vehicle Act. Vehicles which won’t find registration in Agra RTO will easily get registered in neighboring districts and would again come in Agra to operate. “Secondly, there is no tab on the diesel vehicles in Agra. School buses which need to be operated on CNG, run on diesel. Agra municipal corporation garbage carrying trucks also operate on diesel. Buses of UPSRTC also operate on diesel. The RTO needs to look into these flaws also, to curb air pollution.” The RTO has given time till August. “By August end, owners of old vehicles need to register their vehicles in other districts and take NOC to drive. Or action will be taken against such vehicles if caught in Agra jurisdiction,” the RTO said. It comes against the backdrop of increase of particulate matter (PM-2.5 and PM-10) and suspended particulate matter (SPM) in Agra. The annual average ambient air quality monitoring data obtained from central pollution control board revealed that Agra’s air quality is getting worse by each passing year. In 2018, Taj Mahal reported 180 PM-10 level annual average which needs to be at 60. Similarly, the SPM level too was immensely high at 304. Itmad-ud-Daula, Nunhai and Rambagh which are closer to NH-2 and Yamuna expressway recorded PM-10 level at 211, 234 and 194 respectively due to vehicle movement and factories. Man posing as lawyer rapes girl, forces.description: AGRA: A man allegedly raped a 19-year-old girl by impersonating himself as lawyer to frame his rivals in Kasganj district. Accused Narayan Pachauri (27) of Bada Gaon Kotra under Sahawar police jurisdiction, and his father, Ramnaresh Pachauri, who allegedly helped his son in confining the girl in his home, were arrested. According to police, Narayan came in contact with the victim, who hails from an area under Sidhpura police jurisdiction, in May. She was searching for a lawyer to help her mother in a land dispute case with her distant relatives. “Since the girl and her family were not aware of law procedures, the accused misguided the girl and took her with him against her wishes. He raped her and confined her at various locations such as Mathura, Kasganj and Badaun districts. He also hatched a plan to use the girl against his rivals and forced her to file rape charges against them. Narayan also threatened the girl of dire consequences if she doesn’t do as directed. He wrote fake letters and tweeted to the PMO, CMO, DGP, SSP offices mentioning that girl will commit suicide on July 1 if an FIR against his rivals named in the written complaint of rape is not lodged. He was building pressure on the police administration to lodge a false FIR. Later, victim’s brother lodged an FIR against Narayan for confining his sister against her wishes,” said station house officer Rajkumar Singh of Sidhpura. Accused Narayan was also involved in robbery and fraud cases as well, police said. Narayan has been booked under IPC sections 376 (rape), 120B (criminal conspiracy) and 342 (wrongful confinement). BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Illegal eateries a motorists\u2019 night.description: AGRA: Commissioned in August 2012, the 165.5-km-long Yamuna Expressway was introduced for smooth and quick connectivity between Agra and the NCR region. However, with regular accidents and other nightmarish conditions, the state-of-the-art Expressway - which runs parallel to National Highway-2 - has now turned into an ‘ordinary highway’. Unauthorised eateries, bus stands, road interchanges, not only interrupt high-speed traffic, but also increase road accidents. According to available data, 905 people lost their lives and 9,336 were injured in 5,751 road accidents on Yamuna Expressway. Sources of private concessionaire responsible for operating Yamuna Expressway said that over 150 written complaints and reminders were sent to local police stations in Mathura and Gautam Budh Nagar districts about mushrooming of roadside eateries along the Expressway. These eateries often damage and remove barbed wires and fences to gain access to commuters, particularly truck drivers, motorbike riders and even bus passengers. “The situation has become so grim that both state-run government buses and private buses make regular pit stops at these eateries. It seems the drivers have some sort of monetary commission arrangements with these eateries. Sadly, these eateries pose a great threat and many have lost lives after being hit by speeding vehicles near these places,” said Major (retired) Manish Singh, in-charge coordinator of Yamuna Expressway. “Parking vehicles on the Expressway is prohibited unless there is a genuine case of breakdown.” “Apart from eateries, several unauthorised bus stands have cropped up along the Expressway. This also contributes to rise in accidents,” said the Expressway official. Another source claimed that owing to local political pressure to appease residents of rural areas, two interchanges were opened near Baijana (Mathura) and Jewar (Gautam Budh Nagar), where commuters now openly flout traffic norms and travel in wrong directions to save fuel and time. The source also added that trucks carrying cattle to slaughterhouses between Agra and Aligarh stretch pose high risk to commuters, as the drivers tend to overspeed in order to avoid right-wing groups and police teams who either extort money or assault them. The drivers of cattle trucks mainly operate during night hours and “hardly care if they hit anyone on the road in order to save their own lives”. Attempts were made by TOI to contact SSP Mathura and DIG Agra range, but the officers were unavailable for comments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMU VC urges protesting doctors to retur.description: AGRA: A day after the Aligarh Muslim University’s (AMU) Jawahar Lal Nehru Medical College administration declared the Junior doctors’ strike as “illegal”, varsity’s vice chancellor, Tariq Mansoor, has appealed to the 500 protesting doctors to return to work. The doctors had struck work by going on mass earned leave on Monday to protest against the non-implementation of the 7th Pay Commission. Principal of the JNMC, SC Sharma said, “as the resident doctors had gone on leave without any notice or application for a leave in their concerned department, their leave or strike would be considered illegal and strict action will be taken against them”. Spokesperson of the university, Shafey Kidwai, said that the Aligarh Muslim University administration has been in constant touch with the University Grant Commission (UGC) and Ministry of Human Resource & Development (MHRD) officials for the immediate implementation of the revised pay scales and allowances of junior and senior resident doctors of the JNMC, pursuant to the seventh pay commission recommendations. He said, if the protesting students do not join their duty immediately, the administration will be forced to take action as per its rules and regulations. Informing about the latest communication in this regard, Kidwai, while citing Prof Mansoor's letter, said that Mr Rajnish Jain, secretary, UGC has further written to Ms Ishita Roy (IAS), joint secretary (Higher Education), ministry of human resource development, Government of India to "expedite the MHRD concurrence for implementation of the revision of pay and allowances of Junior/Senior Resident Doctors of Medical Colleges/Hospitals of AMU, BHU and University College of Medical Sciences in pursuant to the 7th CPC”. He said, the VC has urged the resident doctors to join back so that the medical facilities are restored to the ailing patients at the earliest. According to the president of the Resident Doctors Association (RDA), Dr Abdullah Azmi, “We had called off out protest earlier after 109 days long-dharna following assurances by the administration but after seeing no positive response from them, we have been forced to go on indefinite mass leave”. He said, medical services are affected but emergency services are working as 80 Senior resident doctors, 350 consultants and around 600 paramedical staff are on duty. He said, that they have been struggling to get their demand implemented for the past one-and-a-half-year but no-one had paid heed to it. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

UP shopkeeper throws hot oil on man for.description: AGRA: A 26-year-old man sustained burn injuries on the upper part of his body after a sweet shop owner threw hot oil on him, straight from the wok, following a dispute over Re 1. The incident happened on Tuesday in Mathura, where the victim’s brother had bought a samosa for Rs 6, but paid only Rs 5, as he didn’t have change. It started a brawl, with the accused Suresh Kumar and his sons abusing and thrashing the victim and his brother. According to victim Hemraj, he and his brother Vishnu, 22, had gone to a sweet shop in Retia market in the morning, where the latter bought a samosa for Rs 6 but could pay only Rs 5. Suresh, the shopkeeper, along with his sons, started abusing and even beating up Vishnu for not paying the remaining Re 1. “Vishnu called me and when I reached there, they (the shopkeeper and his sons) threw hot oil from a pan on me and my brother,” said Hemraj. Hemraj, trying to shield his brother, received major burn injuries, while Vishnu escaped with minor burns. Police, however, said they are investigating whether the shopkeeper had intentionally poured hot oil on the victims or it accidentally fell on them. The shopkeeper, on the other hand, claimed that when he demanded money for the samosa from Vishnu, the latter and his brother vandalized his shop and also looted money. Station house officer (SHO) of Raya police station, Subhash Chandra Pandey, said a case had been registered against seven persons, including Suresh Kumar and his sons, Pramod and Ram Kumar, under sections 326 (voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC, based on a complaint filed by the victim. Pandey said Pramod and Ram Kumar had been arrested while the remaining, including Suresh, were absconding. He said further investigations were on and the rest of the accused would be nabbed soon. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. 80% of seats for Agra University\u2019s.description: AGRA: A large number of seats at Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University are likely to remain vacant for the 2019-20 academic session. The maximum number of vacancies are likely to be of Master of Science programme with no takers for some 80% of the seats. The programme offers 10,600 seats whereas only 2,445 applications has so far been received. The university had conducted an entrance exam for admission to M.Sc course on Saturday. A total of 2,098 applicants appeared whereas 347 remained absent. To bring in transparency in the admission process, university administration had decided to conducted entrance exam for admission in eight courses. These including law and post- graduate courses in science, agriculture and education. Besides tests will also be held for B.Sc agriculture and physical education. Besides M.Sc, several other courses offered by the university will find it difficult to fill up even 50% of seats. For example for the integrated five-year BA LLB course, only 1,028 applications have been received for a total of 2,700 seats. University registrar KN Singh said, “There are several reasons behind fewer applications than total number of seats this time. Some of the reasons that kept away applicants include introduction of entrance exam, strict action against cheating in exams, fair and transparent evaluation and web registration to curb fake students. We are focusing on improving academic standards and enrolling dedicated students.” According to sources, due to fewer enrollments, university administration may not be able to retain cost of running a course and may have to wind it up. Under similar circumstances, Master of Mass Communication (MMC) programme has been discontinued. Over the past two years, the number of students applying for the course significantly decreased. University authorities despite efforts to make improvements decided not to invite applications for the academic session 2019-20 for the course. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jawahar Lal Nehru Medical College doctor.description: AGRA: Despite the warning issued by Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) medical college authorities, the striking junior resident doctors of Jawahar Lal Nehru Medical College failed to return to duty on Thursday, as their strike entered the fourth day, crippling vital healthcare facilities in the region. The doctors had gone on “mass earned leave” on Monday to protest against the non-implementation of the 7th Pay Commission. Serving a notice to the striking doctors on Thursday, principal of the medical college, SC Sharma stated, "Junior residents of batch 2019 are not entitled to avail any type of leave as they have been admitted in May this year only.” He added that the strike had already been declared “illegal”. He further stated, "All chairpersons/directors are required to send the daily attendance report of unauthorised absence of junior residents to the office. The tenure of junior residents may be extended in view of their absence from their duties without prior information and leave applications to their concerned chairpersons”. While, reports claimed that five deaths had occurred in the hospital since Monday due to the strike, Sharma said that such deaths at the tertiary care unit are routine. He said, though the health care facilities are being affected due to the absence of 500 doctors in the hospital, on an average 8-20 deaths are reported per day, as serious patients come to the hospital at the last moment. He told TOI that emergency/Casualty section will remain functional for University students, employees and patients of first aid management. ICU/CCW will function as usual and OPD will also remain open with registrations to be done at 10.30am. He added that the operation theatres will remain functional for medical and surgical procedure of admitted patients with consultation of their concerned anaesthesiologists. AMU students raise objections over Yoga.description: AGRA: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) students have raised objections on Yoga celebrations in the campus, as common sitting arrangements have been made by the administration for men and women. According to students, these celebrations are nothing but a waste of money, as no one would become healthier by doing yoga for a day. Former president of Students’ Union, Faizul Hassan, said that the administration should have made separate arrangements for male and female, as Islam has strongly emphasized the concept of decency and modesty in the interaction of the opposite sex. He further said, “in Islam, we offer namaz five times a day and it’s like performing yoga,” he added that any Muslim who offers namaz five times a day does not need to do any yoga. Hassan said that these celebrations are meaningless and if the authorities want to make any real difference, they should have yoga classes round the year. AMU court member, Shafikurhman Khan from theology department also opposed the Yoga day celebration in the university. He said, “We welcome yoga if it it is part of the curriculum but not if it is forced under a particular ideology”. He added that it’s unfortunate that Yoga instead of being seen as a science had been given a given a communal colour. Former vice-president of students’ union Hamza Sufyan said that the amount which is being spent for Yoga celebrations should be spend on education as the varsity’s budget has been going down every year. Talking to TOI, Spokesperson of the university, Shafey Kidwai said, these are all baseless allegations. He said, if students can study together then why can’t do Yoga together. On the issue of one day Yoga celebration, Kidwai, said that a week long celebrations are planned for International Yoga Day. According to AMU administration, the varsity has been observing International Yoga Day since 2015, but this year the celebrations have been marked by a series of events. Some prominent yoga exponents have been invited to deliver lectures and hold workshops. The week-long programme is being organised by AMU’s Department of Physical Education. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Agra: Man stages abduction to skip court.description: AGRA: A man was arrested by Malpura police of Agra district for allegedly staging his own abduction in order to avoid appearing in the court in a loan repayment case. Resident of Sarai Pukhta under Fatehpur Sikri police jurisdiction, the accused, identified as Shavazz Ahmad, was arrested from Medakur area on Wednesday morning. Ahmad owns a small garment store at Kheria Mod under Shahganj police jurisdiction. According to police, on June 12, Riyaz Ahmad, father of the accused, had lodged an FIR at Malpura police station under IPC section 364 A (Kidnapping For Ransom) against Shavazz’s previous employers. Giving details about the case, station house officer (SHO) of Malpura, Vijay Kumar Singh, said, “During the probe, we came to know that Shavazz Ahmad used to work at the garment store owned by Rajendra Goel and Shivkumar Goel in Bansal market. After sometime, he borrowed a hefty amount from his employers and opened his own store at Kheria Mod. However, Shavazz failed to repay the amount to the trader duo who then sought help from the court and filed a case against Shavazz for cheating, fraud and criminal intimidation. He said, “With the help of his 13-year-old nephew, Shavazz spread a fake message of abduction and held Rajendra Goel and Shivkumar Goel responsible for the crime. When we asked the teenaged boy to narrate the sequence of his uncle’s abduction, he broke down and let the cat out of the bag. Shavazz went off to Chennai via Delhi to his friend’s house. Later, he returned to Agra and was caught on an anonymous tip off.” Accused Shavazz was booked under IPC sections 120B (Punishment of Criminal Conspiracy), 193 (Punishment For False Evidence), 195 (Giving Or Fabricating False Evidence With Intent To Procure Conviction Of Offence Punishable With Imprisonment For Life Or Imprisonment) and 211 (False Charge Of Offence Made With Intent To Injure). On Wednesday, he was sent to jail. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
